results.title: Eulogy For A Black Mass

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: Aria Dean explores the black creative labour put into memes, images defined not by their content but by how they are circulated, mutated and compressed - International Film Festival Rotterdam
description_for_label: Aria Dean explores the black creative labour put into memes, images defined not by their content but by how they are circulated, mutated and compressed - International Film Festival Rotterdam

results.title: Eugene O'Neill's: The Iceman cometh
results.creator_credit: Ely Landau, John Frankenheimer, Ely Landau Organization and American Express Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
In this searing film adaptation of Eugene O’Neill’s play, Robert Ryan stars as Larry, a barfly and self proclaimed philosopher eagerly awaiting death all but for his iron constitution. He and his gang of drunk cronies anticipate the periodical visit of Hickey (Lee Marvin) who usually turns up in a generous mood and with generous purse for the bar owner Harry (Frederic March) and the whole gang. This time, however, he is late in arriving and everyone is on edge and the anticipation of the bender they are about to go on is rousing them out of their alcoholic stupor. Hickey’s visit doesn’t bring them the fun they were hoping for; he instead challenges them all to forget their hopes and dreams and deal with reality. He is especially hard on Larry but his words affect more deeply the young Don Parritt (Jeff Bridges) whose relationship with his mother is a reality too hard for him to bear.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ely Landau, John Frankenheimer, Ely Landau Organization and American Express Films

results.title: Eudyptula Minor (Fairy Penguins)
results.creator_credit: Art Mayer, Comalco and Graham Pizzey
results.brief_description: Inhabiting the milder waters of southern Australia and New Zealand, the Fairy Penguin does not grow to the height of its companions in the Antarctic regions; it stands about 16 inches tall. This film shot at Summerlands Beach, a protected nesting ground on Phillip Island, follows the penguins through their daily routine, beginning with their return from the sea at dusk after fishing.
